Patient.description: The name, age, and sex of the patient.

Key Highlights for Medical Decision-Maki.description: A detailed, bulleted list that outlines the key points and areas for improvement in the medical decision-making process, including each plan item, medication recommendations (with alternatives), anticipatory preventative care, and follow up care.

Chief Concern.description: The chief concern of the patient.

Assessment.description: A detailed assessment statement constructed from the patient chart, including rationales and evidence-based suggestions.

Plan.description: The treatment plan along with various problems and preventative care items.

Problem Name.description: State the name of the problem.

Status.description: State the status (e.g., stable, not stable, at goal, not at goal, etc) and clinical response of the problem.

Decision Making and Diagnositic Plan.description: A detailed explanation of the decision-making and diagnostic plan constructed from the patient chart, with supporting rationales.

Treatment/Medication Plan.description: A comprehensive treatment/medication plan constructed from the patient chart, including rationale for chosen therapies.

Contingency Planning.description: A detailed description of the contingency plan, including if-this-then-that scenarios and supporting rationale.

Considerations for Documentation Improve.description: Considerations and specific suggestions, with rationale, for documentation improvement for problem 1 goes here.

Considerations for Cost Effective Care I.description: Considerations and detailed suggestions, with supporting rationale, for cost effective care improvement problem 1 goes here.

required: Considerations for Cost Effective Care Improvement

Item 1.description: A detailed,  recommendation for Preventative Care Item 1 with evidence-based rationale.

Item 2.description: A detailed,  recommendation for Preventative Care Item 2 with evidence-based rationale.

Item 6.description: A detailed,  recommendation for Preventative Care Item 6 with evidence-based rationale.

Considerations for Documentation Improve.description: A  discussion of how documentation for anticipatory preventative care could be improved.

Item 1.description: A detailed,  recommendation for Follow Up Care Item 1 with supporting rationale.

Item 2.description: A detailed,  recommendation for Follow Up Care Item 2 with supporting rationale.

Item 3.description: A detailed,  recommendation for Follow Up Care Item 3 with supporting rationale.

Item 4.description: A detailed,  recommendation for Follow Up Care Item 4 with supporting rationale.

Item 5.description: A detailed,  recommendation for Follow Up Care Item 5 with supporting rationale.

Item 6.description: A detailed,  recommendation for Follow Up Care Item 6 with supporting rationale.

Considerations for Documentation Improve.description: A  analysis of how follow up care documentation could be enhanced with specific examples.
